wikipedia_page.main: Louis Sinclair (1861–1928) was Conservative MP for Romford.He won the seat at the 1897 Romford by-election, held it in 1900, but lost it in the 1906 Liberal landslide.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1895 United Kingdom general election
response: *1 February: Romford - Louis Sinclair, Conservative, replacing Alfred Wigram

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1900 United Kingdom general election

response: The 1897 Romford by-election was held on 1 February 1897 after the retirement of the incumbent Conservative MP Alfred Money Wigram.  The seat was retained by the Conservative Party candidate Louis Sinclair.
